subject: Politics
title: India's Balancing Act
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on India's Balancing Act.

hook.text: India buys weapons from Russia and technology from the US. It refuses to pick a side â€” and both sides need it.

buildup.text: India is the world's most populous country with a rapidly growing economy. It's a swing state in global politics.

discovery.text: India's 'strategic autonomy' policy means it partners with everyone and allies with no one permanently.

twist.text: China is India's biggest rival and trading partner. Their border conflict in the Himalayas is unresolved.

climax.text: As India grows, its neutrality becomes harder to maintain. Both the US and China pressure it to commit.

punchline.text: India plays all sides. As its power grows, staying neutral gets harder.

quiz.question: What is India's 'strategic autonomy' policy?
options: Partnering with multiple nations without committing to permanent alliances
Maintaining complete isolation from global affairs
